dt: {bc}a body part or organ: such as
{bc}a unit of structure in a plant body
{bc}one of the individuals composing a group
{bc}a person baptized or enrolled in a church
{bc}a part of a whole: such as
{bc}a syntactic or rhythmic unit of a sentence {bc}{sx|clause||}
{bc}one of the propositions of a syllogism
{bc}one of the elements of a set or class
{bc}either of the equated elements in a mathematical equation

pt: {sc}part{/sc} {sc}portion{/sc} {sc}piece{/sc} {sc}member{/sc} {sc}division{/sc} {sc}section{/sc} {sc}segment{/sc} {sc}fragment{/sc} mean something less than the whole. {sc}part{/sc} is a general term appropriate when indefiniteness is required.

pt.t: they ran only {it}part{/it} of the way

pt: {sc}portion{/sc} implies an assigned or allotted part.
{sc}piece{/sc} applies to a separate or detached part of a whole.
{sc}member{/sc} suggests one of the functional units composing a body.
{sc}division{/sc} applies to a large or diversified part.
{sc}section{/sc} applies to a relatively small or uniform part.
{sc}segment{/sc} applies to a part separated or marked out by or as if by natural lines of cleavage.
{sc}fragment{/sc} applies to a part produced by or as if by breaking off.

pt.t: only a {it}fragment{/it} of the play still exists

et: Middle English {it}membre{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}membrum{/it}; akin to Goth {it}mimz{/it} flesh, Greek {it}mēros{/it} thigh
shortdef: a body part or organ: such as

dt: {bc}an original member of a group (such as a society or corporation)

shortdef: an original member of a group (such as a society or corporation)

dt: {bc}one of two or more members of a group {bc}a fellow member

dt.t: … Durham and his committee {wi}co-members{/wi} still are planning more growth beyond Europe.

shortdef: one of two or more members of a group : a fellow member

dt: {bc}a person who is a member of the armed forces

dt.t: Once Federal Judge Martin Barash administered the oath of allegiance and spoke about their new responsibilities and privileges, he singled out each {wi}service member{/wi} by name (the only new citizens offered this recognition), and the crowd responded with standing ovations.

For three-quarters of a century, East Helena has proudly honored {wi}servicemembers{/wi} with a monument in the heart of town. And now community leaders are looking for names of area veterans as they rebuild the monument with a new design.

shortdef: a person who is a member of the armed forces

dt: {bc}one of the several members joining the top and bottom chords of a truss or lattice girder

shortdef: one of the several members joining the top and bottom chords of a truss or lattice girder

dt: {bc}a bill prepared or introduced in the British House of Commons by a member who is not a minister in the government

shortdef: a bill prepared or introduced in the British House of Commons by a member who is not a minister in the government

dt: {bc}the people of a country, state, etc.

dt.t: The beach is open to {it}the public{/it}.
{phrase}The general public{/phrase} is in favor of the law.
{phrase}Members of the public{/phrase} called for the mayor's resignation.

shortdef: the people of a country, state, etc.
